title: >>> THEN and NOW
body_text:
It's a double dose of news right here on
www.dodgeball.livejournal.com
!
DODGEBALL 68 appears to be the "End of the Road" in more ways then one.
Dark Days
Over?
It appears as though light troubles won't be much trouble at all. After speaking with a Maintanance and Grounds person earlier in the week, John Tronolone has received some powerful information:
"On Monday, I personally went down to the maintanance and grounds building over at Wall High School, and was informed that a new timer was needed in order for the lights to work again. The timer, as the gentleman explained, has already been installed as there shouldn't be any problems anymore.
However, he also let me know of the lights not remaining on until 11pm. According to him, they will now go off at 9:30pm, in what he feels may have been persuaded by some of the nearby residents. I will see what I can do in terms of keeping the lights on further, but until then, if he was indeed sure of the situation, we have the bright tennis lights once again."
Short, but Sensational
Players of all ages and sizes come from all around the county to play one of the greatest games alive. But for one star, the days of dodgeball may be coming to an end.
At the massive DODGEBALL LX, Kerrin Marchese's dodgeball journey began, making a huge impact in the process. Since then, she has participated in a number of events, perhaps becoming the fasting rising female sensation since Sara DeCuir last November.
But unfornately for Kerrin and moreso her friends, she does not live in the county, nor in the state of New Jersey. Though attending Monmouth University in West Long Branch, she calls Maryland her home, a state in which she has lived for many, many years.
She is sadly transferring out of Monmouth University to Towson University, a school located in her home state. The sudden and shocking news broke late last week to several dodgeball competitors at the LX SEVEN "afterparty".
Kerrin's final event will be at DODGEBALL 68 this coming Saturday, December 16th. Come out and show your support for one dodgeball's newest legends.
On behalf of everyone in the dodgeball community, "thank you" and "good luck" to Kerrin in all her future endeavors.

It's a double dose of news right here on www.dodgeball.livejournal.com!

DODGEBALL 68 appears to be the "End of the Road" in more ways then one.

Dark Days Over?
It appears as though light troubles won't be much trouble at all. After speaking with a Maintanance and Grounds person earlier in the week, John Tronolone has received some powerful information:

"On Monday, I personally went down to the maintanance and grounds building over at Wall High School, and was informed that a new timer was needed in order for the lights to work again. The timer, as the gentleman explained, has already been installed as there shouldn't be any problems anymore.

However, he also let me know of the lights not remaining on until 11pm. According to him, they will now go off at 9:30pm, in what he feels may have been persuaded by some of the nearby residents. I will see what I can do in terms of keeping the lights on further, but until then, if he was indeed sure of the situation, we have the bright tennis lights once again."

Short, but Sensational
Players of all ages and sizes come from all around the county to play one of the greatest games alive. But for one star, the days of dodgeball may be coming to an end.

At the massive DODGEBALL LX, Kerrin Marchese's dodgeball journey began, making a huge impact in the process. Since then, she has participated in a number of events, perhaps becoming the fasting rising female sensation since Sara DeCuir last November.

But unfornately for Kerrin and moreso her friends, she does not live in the county, nor in the state of New Jersey. Though attending Monmouth University in West Long Branch, she calls Maryland her home, a state in which she has lived for many, many years.

She is sadly transferring out of Monmouth University to Towson University, a school located in her home state. The sudden and shocking news broke late last week to several dodgeball competitors at the LX SEVEN "afterparty".

Kerrin's final event will be at DODGEBALL 68 this coming Saturday, December 16th. Come out and show your support for one dodgeball's newest legends.

On behalf of everyone in the dodgeball community, "thank you" and "good luck" to Kerrin in all her future endeavors.
